Draw the second line from point 0.375,0 to point 0.375,0.75. 3. Draw the third line from point 0.375,0.75 to point 0,0.75. 4. Draw the fourth line from point 0,0.75 to point 0,0. Extruding Part 1 1. Scale the sketch by 0.75. 2. Extrude the scaled sketch by 0.225 units along the normal direction. Part 2 Instructions Creating the Second Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0, 0, 0 and a translation vector of 0.0188, 0.0188, 0.225. Creating the Sketch for Part 2 Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system. 1. Draw the first line from point 0,0 to point 0.3375,0. 2. Draw the second line from point 0.3375,0 to point 0.3375,0.7125. 3. Draw the third line from point 0.3375,0.7125 to point 0,0.7125. 4. Draw the fourth line from point 0,0.7125 to point 0,0. Extruding Part 2 1. Scale the sketch by 0.7125. 2. Extrude the scaled sketch by 0.0188 units along the normal direction. 3. Join the extruded sketch with the previous part. The final shape is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 0.75 x 0.75 x 0.24 units. The first part has dimensions of approximately 0.3 x 0.75 x 0.225 units and the second part has dimensions of approximately 0.34 x 0.71 x 0.0188 units.</description>
